intro: Panicum lagopus, commonly known as the western grasshopper sparrow, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the grass family, Poaceae, and typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that contain numerous tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it is often found in association with other native grasses. The species is adapted to thrive in arid conditions and is an important part of the ecosystem in its native range.
